trans-unit.source: Al is more reactive than Cu and it can displace Cu from CuSO4 solution and form a colourless solution of Al2(SO4)3.
Al is more reactive than Fe and it can displace Fe from FeSO4 solution and form a colourless solution of Al2(SO4)3.
Al is more reactive than Zn and it can displace Zn from ZnSO4 solution and form a colourless solution of Al2(SO4)3.
Aluminium
Click on the information icon to see the inference.
Copper
Cu is less reactive than Al. So it cannot displace the metals from their salt solutions.
Cu is less reactive than Fe. So it cannot displace the metals from their salt solutions.
Cu is less reactive than Zn. So it cannot displace the metals from their salt solutions.
Select the metals from the drop down menu.
Al is more reactive than Zn, Fe & Cu. So it displaces these metals from ZnSO4, FeSO4 & CuSO4 solutions.
Zn is more reactive than Fe,Cu. So it can displace these metals from FeSO4, CuSO4 solution respectively. Zn is less reactive than Al so it can't displace Al from Al2(SO4)3.
Fe is is more reactive than Cu. So it can displace CuSO4 solution respectively.Fe is less reactive than Zn,Al and it can't displace these metals from those salt solution.
Cu is more reactive than Zn,Fe,Al. So it can't displace these metals from those salt solution.
Zn is more reactive than Cu/Fe and it can displace Cu/Fe from CuSO4/FeSO4 solution to form a colourless solution of (ZnSO4).No change is observed in Al2(SO4)3.
Instruction:
Iron
There is no change. This indicates that Fe is less reactive than the other two metals Al and Zn so it cannot displace these metals from their salt solutions.
Fe is more reactive than Cu and it can displace Cu from CuSO4 solution and form a light green coloured FeSO4 solution.
Click and drag forceps to add 2 pieces of metals into the beaker
Select the metals
Variables:
Zinc
No change is observed. Because Zn is less reactive than Al so it cannot displace Al from Al2(SO4)3 solution.
Zn is more reactive than Cu and it can displace Cu from CuSO4 solution to form a colourless solution of (ZnSO4).
Zn is more reactive than Fe and it can displace Fe from (FeSO4) solution and form a colourless solution of (ZnSO4).
